title: Singapore just used its fake news law. Critics say it's just what they feared
text: Singapore just showed the world how it plans to use a controversial new law to tackle what it deems fake news — and critics say it's just what they expected would happen.

title: Facebook's Total Yield From Its Buyback Program Will Push Its Stock Higher
text: Facebook's buyback program uses about 20% or higher of its FCF each quarter, or $1.3 billion. This is likely to increase to $1.5 billion in Q4.

title: Facebook Faces Showdown With Singapore Over New ‘Fake News Law’
text: Singapore has ordered Facebook to publish a correction on a social media post from a user in a test for a new law meant to tackle online disinformation.

title: Facebook to Buy Beat Games, Ups Ante in VR Gaming Space
text: Facebook's (FB) Beat Games acquisition is expected to expand its VR game content portfolio, which will eventually help it sell more VR hardware devices.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook blames holiday outages on central software system
text: Facebook Inc. said it had restored service to users of its Facebook, Messenger and Instagram platforms, after an hourslong outage that disrupted many users’ ability to access them on Thanksgiving Day.

title: 10 Tech Giants That Are (Almost All) in Bad Shape
text: Many US tech giants have been going through a rough patch recently. And so today I simply wanted to sift through the list and assess the situation.

title: Singapore tells Facebook to correct user's post in test of 'fake news' laws
text: Singapore instructed Facebook on Friday to publish a correction notice on a user's social media post under a new 'fake news' law, raising fresh questions about how the firm will adhere to government requests to regulate content.
